de.eckhartarnold.client

Class ControlPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Composite
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.ControlPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttachmentListener, ResizeListener, SlideshowListener

    public class ControlPanel
extends Composite
implements SlideshowListener, ResizeListener, AttachmentListener
    The control panel of the slide show.

    The control panel consists of up to four buttons: back, gallery, play, next and an optional progress bar. In addition to that the control panel can "swallow" a film strip which will be placed in the middle between the gallery and the play button. The buttons can be disabled or completely be hidden (methods setButtonEnable and setButtonShow).

    Author:
    eckhart

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControlPanel

        public ControlPanel(Slideshow slideshow)
        The constructor of class ControlPanel. The control panel is initialized with a slide show. By default it features a progress bar and all buttons are visible and enabled.
        Parameters:
        slideshow - the slide show to which this control panel shall be attached

    • Method Detail

      • loadImageSet

        protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Image> loadImageSet(int size)
        Loads a set of icons for the control buttons corresponding to the given size. The icons must be stored in the "icons" sub-directory and be named appropriately, e.g. "next_down_24.png" is the icon with an edge size of 24 pixels for the "next" button when it is pressed.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the icons.
        Returns:
        a map where the respective images are indexed by their name (without suffix or size indicator, e.g. a proper index would be "next_down" but not "next_down_24.png"

      • allowAutoResize

        public void allowAutoResize()
        Allows automatic adjustment of the size of the control panel if the size of the image panel changes.

      • disallowAutoResize

        public void disallowAutoResize()
        Disallows automatic adjustment of the size of the control panel if the size of the image panel changes.

      • getCrtlBtnSize

        public int getCrtlBtnSize()
        Returns the size of the control buttons as integer value. The size is automatically adjusted by the onResized method. It is guaranteed to have a value greater or equal than 8 and smaller or equal than 128, but usually it is one of the values: 16,24,32,40,48,64.
        Returns:
        the edge size of the control buttons in pixel.

        public void hideProgressBar()
        Hides the progress bar.

        public void onFade()
        Description copied from interface: SlideshowListener
        Called when a new image starts fading in. The number of the image that is faded in can be queried via Slideshow.getCurrentSlide onFade() will not be called if fading is disabled or skipped for some other reason!
        Specified by:
        onFade in interface SlideshowListener

        Description copied from interface: SlideshowListener

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
        Called after a parent widget has been resized, but before the new size is processed via onResized. The method prepareResized is needed to allow composite widgets that contain absolute panels to temporarily detach these absolute panels in order to allow the browser to calculate widget sizes correctly. The implementation of onResized can then re-attach the detached absolute panels. Methods prepareResized and onResized should therefore always be used in conjunction.
        Specified by:
        prepareResized in interface ResizeListener

      • setButtonEnabled

        public void setButtonEnabled(int buttonFlags)
        Determines which buttons are enabled on the panel. If the play button is disabled, the slide show will be stopped in case it was running.
        Parameters:
        buttonFlags - the bit set of the buttons that are to be enabled

      • setButtonShow

        public void setButtonShow(int buttonFlags)
        Determines which buttons are shown on the panel. If the play button is hidden the slide show will be stopped in case it was running.
        Parameters:
        buttonFlags - the bit set of the buttons that are to be shown

      • setCtrlBtnSizePx

        public void setCtrlBtnSizePx(int size)
        Sets the size of the control buttons. If the new size is widely different form the old one, this involves picking a fresh set of icons for the control buttons.
        Parameters:
        size - the edge size of each control button in pixel.

      • setHomeButtonListener

        public void setHomeButtonListener(ClickHandler handler)
        Sets the listener for the "back to the gallery button". In order to listen to any of the other buttons, add a SlideshowListener to the slide show.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ClickListener for the gallery button

      • showProgressBar

        public void showProgressBar()
        Shows the progress bar.

      • swallowFilmstrip

        public void swallowFilmstrip(Filmstrip filmstrip,
                    boolean selectableImages)
        Swallows a Filmstrip widget. The film strip will then become part of the control panel. The control panel will automatically be resized so that it covers the full width of the browser window (or the parent widget).
        Parameters:
        filmstrip - the film strip widget
        selectableImages - true, if the images of the film strip shall be made selectable so that by clicking on one them the slide show jumps to that image

      • composePanel

        protected void composePanel()
        (Re-)creates the button panel using the images stored in the icons map as symbols on the buttons.

      • enableOrDisableButtons

        protected void enableOrDisableButtons()
        Transfers the state of the buttonsEnabled flags which can be set with method setButtonEnabled to the button widgets.
